message_1: Suppose there are three fishermen who share a lake, and each of them can catch a maximum of 10 fish per day. The lake has a maximum capacity of 30 fish per day. If one fisherman catches 8 fish, what is the maximum number of fish the other two fishermen can catch together without exceeding the maximum sustainable yield of the lake?
message_2: If one fisherman catches 8 fish, there are 30 - 8 = 22 fish remaining for the other two fishermen to catch together without exceeding the maximum sustainable yield of the lake.
